meanings.sent1: The cat irrupting into the room startled everyone.
meanings.sent2: The burglars irrupted into the house in the middle of the night.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel irrupting into the picnic basket made for a comical sight.
meanings.sent4: The storm irrupting into the peaceful evening sky was a dramatic scene.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected guest irrupting into the party caused quite a stir.

meanings.sent1: The weeds irrupting in the garden needed immediate attention.
meanings.sent2: The population of rabbits irrupted, causing a shortage of food.
meanings.sent3: The laughter irrupting from the children playing was contagious.
meanings.sent4: The excitement irrupting in the stadium was palpable.
meanings.sent5: The chaos irrupting in the classroom required swift action.

meanings.definition: A sudden increase in numbers or activity
meanings.sent1: The irrupting of tourists during the holiday season was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: The irrupting of messages on his phone made it hard to keep up.
meanings.sent3: The irrupting of colors in the painting created a vibrant masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The irrupting of cheers from the crowd lifted the team's spirits.
meanings.sent5: The irrupting of ideas during the brainstorming session was inspiring.
